location_machine_xrefs.condition: The issues with the drop target and the left slingshot have been resolved, but the upper flipper is still gone, and the code has still not been updated. Communicating with the operator is like talking to a brick wall. I cannot obtain any contact information, and any Post-it Notes I leave on the machine are soon removed without anything getting done.

machine_conditions.comment: The issues with the drop target and the left slingshot have been resolved, but the upper flipper is still gone, and the code has still not been updated. Communicating with the operator is like talking to a brick wall. I cannot obtain any contact information, and any Post-it Notes I leave on the machine are soon removed without anything getting done.

June 6th, 2017: The upper-right flipper has been outright removed, and the drop target at the Vengeance has stopped working with two balls stuck behind it. In addition, the solenoid for the left slingshot has somehow emerged in front of its rubber. Together, these render much of the playfield unusable. It is also still at its base code.

The Vengeance drop target has been fixed, as is the start button. It is still at its base code, however, and in addition the "Save the Enterprise" light being out, so is the "Up" light on the top rollovers.

March 15th, 2016: This game is at its base code, meaning you can time out modes to easily reach Kobayashi Maru Multiball, but level 2 modes are unwinnable. The drop target below the Vengeance does not fall all the way, making many modes impossible to reach (including Kobayashi Maru). "Save the Enterprise" light is now completely out.

Tilt rather loose now. Can give nice shake save. Could use a code update, but worth a visit.

February 11th, 2014: "Save the Enterprise" light seems very dim. (I suspect the LED is dislodged.) Right coin slot rejects everything. Otherwise, it seems to be working just fine. The left scoop may need adjusting though, as it sends the ball onto the top of the left slingshot, where there's a good chance it'll drain down the left outlane.

August 6th, 2014: The game believes a ball is stuck, but it's nowhere in sight.
